fields.summary: S3 creds added to a hidden list by HIVE-14588 are not working on MR jobs

comments.body: [~lskuff] FYI
[~spena] Is the mapreduce.job.redacted-properties newly introduced by MAPREDUCE-6741 only available in Hadoop 2.9 and above? If so, it is not applicable to current Hive.
Restarted ptest. Reuploading the patch for precommit tests.

Oh, I did not notice that. Thanks for the heads up.
[~spena] suggest you also change the call to stripHiddenConfigurations() in ql/exec/tez/DagUtils.createConfiguration(), because this is currently broken for running hive-blobstore suite against Tez.
Thanks [~poeppt].
Ping?

ATTACHMENT ID: 12830630 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
Have we completely dropped this patch?

[~poeppt] Sorry for answering late. I was waiting until we support hadoop 2.9 in order to use this new variable. I could add it today, but it won't have any effect until hadoop 2.9 is released.

Do you think we should have this patch now? Regarding the Tez issue, I don't have a Tez engine running to verify it. If you're working on Tez, would you like to continue on this patch if you have free time?

Good point [~spena], doesn't make sense to have this before Hadoop 2.9. Here's the issue I was facing -- when running against "real S3" using the Tez execution engine, the credentials passed via hive-site.xml are not passed to individual Tez workers, which fails the tests. There are ways around this, and myself and my team have successfully worked around it.

Honestly, if nobody else has any issue, I'm happy to wait on this for Hadoop 2.9.0 as well. I'll try to track on my end so we don't drop this issue by accident.

Hello, [~spena] I am deferring this to Hive 3.0 as we are going to cut the first RC and it is not marked as blocker. Please feel free to commit to the branch if this can be resolved before the release.

Have¬† we decided to completely ignore this issue in hive then ?¬† This is a major problem.¬† We run jobs for our customers on their cluster and other that¬† changing the hidden¬† list , I do not know of any other workaround.¬†¬†

What is the current plan for this issue ?

I also do not see a patch for the cited Tez issue .What is going with that ?
